title: Zephaniah Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Zephaniah with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 3 chapters.

questions.question: Who was Zephaniah's father according to Zephaniah 1:1?
questions.explanation: Zephaniah 1:1 states that Zephaniah was the son of Cushi.

questions.question: What is the primary theme introduced in Zephaniah 1:2?
questions.explanation: Zephaniah 1:2 speaks about utterly consuming all things from off the land, indicating judgment.

questions.question: Zephaniah 1:3 mentions the consumption of all except one of the following. Which one is NOT mentioned as being consumed?
questions.explanation: The verse lists man, beast, fowls, and fishes but not trees.

questions.question: In Zephaniah 1:4, the LORD will cut off the remnant of which group from Judah?
questions.explanation: The verse specifically mentions cutting off the remnant of Baal and the Chemarims.

questions.question: According to Zephaniah 1:5, on what locations did some worship the host of heaven?
questions.explanation: Zephaniah 1:5 mentions worship on the housetops.

questions.question: What is the warning given in Zephaniah 1:7 about the day of the LORD?
options: It is a day of peace
It is a day of sacrifice prepared by the LORD
It is a day of rejoicing
It is a day of harvest
questions.correctAnswer: It is a day of sacrifice prepared by the LORD
questions.explanation: The verse says the LORD has prepared a sacrifice and bid his guests.

questions.question: In Zephaniah 1:8, who will be punished on the day of the LORD's sacrifice?
questions.explanation: The verse specifically mentions princes and king's children will be punished.

questions.question: Zephaniah 1:9 says the LORD will punish those who do what on the threshold?
questions.explanation: The verse refers to those that leap on the threshold who fill masters' houses with violence and deceit.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'fish gate' mentioned in Zephaniah 1:10?
options: A gate of Jerusalem that will hear a cry
questions.correctAnswer: A gate of Jerusalem that will hear a cry
questions.explanation: The verse describes a noise of a cry from the fish gate, signaling distress.

questions.question: True or False: Zephaniah 1:11 declares that all merchant people are preserved.
questions.explanation: The verse says all the merchant people are cut down.

questions.question: What method does the LORD say He will use to search Jerusalem in Zephaniah 1:12?
questions.explanation: The verse says the LORD will search Jerusalem with candles.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Zephaniah 1:13 says, 'Therefore their goods shall become a _______, and their houses a desolation.'
questions.explanation: The verse uses 'booty' to describe what their goods will become.

questions.question: What is the tone of the day described in Zephaniah 1:14?
options: A day of wrath and trouble
questions.correctAnswer: A day of wrath and trouble
questions.explanation: The verse describes it as the great day of the LORD, a day of wrath and trouble.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT mentioned as a characteristic of the day of the LORD in Zephaniah 1:15?
questions.explanation: Joy is not mentioned; the day is described with negative attributes.

questions.question: Zephaniah 1:16 speaks of a day of trumpet and alarm against what?
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states the day is against fenced cities and high towers.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zephaniah 1:18, silver and gold will save people in the day of the LORD's wrath.
questions.explanation: The verse says neither silver nor gold shall be able to deliver them.

questions.question: In Zephaniah 2:1, what is the LORD calling the people to do?
questions.explanation: The verse calls for gathering together, indicating a call to repentance or unity.

questions.question: According to Zephaniah 2:3, what qualities should the meek of the earth seek?
questions.explanation: The verse advises seeking righteousness and meekness to be hid in the day of the LORD's anger.

questions.question: Which Philistine city is mentioned in Zephaniah 2:4 as being forsaken?
questions.explanation: The verse specifically states Gaza shall be forsaken.

questions.question: Zephaniah 2:5 refers to the inhabitants of the sea coast as the nation of what?
questions.explanation: The verse calls them the nation of the Cherethites.

questions.question: True or False: Zephaniah 2:7 promises that the remnant of Judah will feed and lie down in the houses of Ashkelon.
questions.explanation: The verse says the remnant of Judah shall feed upon the coast and lie down in Ashkelon.

questions.question: Zephaniah 2:9 compares Moab and the children of Ammon to which two cities?
questions.explanation: The verse likens Moab to Sodom and Ammon to Gomorrah.

questions.question: What is the LORD's attitude toward the gods of the earth in Zephaniah 2:11?
questions.explanation: The verse says the LORD will be terrible and famish all the gods of the earth.

questions.question: Which northern empire is mentioned in Zephaniah 2:13 as being destroyed?
questions.explanation: The verse mentions destruction of Assyria and Nineveh becoming a desolation.

questions.question: What creatures are said to lodge in the windows of Nineveh in Zephaniah 2:14?
questions.explanation: The verse describes these birds lodging in the upper lintels of the city.

questions.question: True or False: Zephaniah 2:15 describes Nineveh as a city that dwelt carelessly and will become a desolation.
questions.explanation: The verse calls Nineveh a rejoicing city that dwelt carelessly and will become desolate.

questions.question: In Zephaniah 3:1, the city described as filthy and polluted is called what?
questions.explanation: The chapter context and later verses identify the city as Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to Zephaniah 3:2, which three things did the city NOT do?
options: Obey, receive correction, trust in the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Obey, receive correction, trust in the LORD
questions.explanation: The verse says the city did not obey, receive correction, nor trust in the LORD.

questions.question: In Zephaniah 3:3, the princes are compared to what kind of animals?
questions.explanation: The verse calls the princes roaring lions.

questions.question: What does Zephaniah 3:4 say about the prophets and priests?
options: They are light, treacherous, and have polluted the sanctuary
They lead the people in righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: They are light, treacherous, and have polluted the sanctuary
questions.explanation: The verse accuses prophets and priests of being treacherous and polluting the sanctuary.

questions.question: True or False: Zephaniah 3:5 states that the just LORD is in the midst of the city and will fail in judgment.
questions.explanation: The verse says the LORD will not fail in judgment; He brings judgment to light every morning.

questions.question: According to Zephaniah 3:6, what has God done to the nations and their cities?
options: Cut off their inhabitants and made their cities waste
questions.correctAnswer: Cut off their inhabitants and made their cities waste
questions.explanation: The verse describes cutting off nations and desolating their cities.

questions.question: What does Zephaniah 3:7 say about the people's response to God's punishment?
questions.explanation: The verse says they rose early and corrupted all their doings instead of fearing God.

questions.question: Zephaniah 3:8 calls for waiting upon the LORD until what happens?
options: He rises up to the prey and pours out indignation
questions.correctAnswer: He rises up to the prey and pours out indignation
questions.explanation: The verse calls for waiting until the day the LORD rises to gather kingdoms for judgment.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Zephaniah 3:9 states, 'For then will I turn to the people a ______ language.'
questions.explanation: The LORD will turn to the people a pure language so they may call upon His name.

questions.question: From where will the LORD's suppliants come according to Zephaniah 3:10?
questions.explanation: The verse mentions suppliants from beyond the rivers of Ethiopia.

questions.question: True or False: Zephaniah 3:11 promises that those who rejoice in pride will be removed from the city.
questions.explanation: The verse says the LORD will take away those who rejoice in pride.

questions.question: According to Zephaniah 3:12, what kind of people will be left in the city?
options: Afflicted and poor who trust in the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Afflicted and poor who trust in the LORD
questions.explanation: The verse describes an afflicted and poor people trusting in the LORD being left.

questions.question: Zephaniah 3:13 says the remnant of Israel shall do all EXCEPT:
options: Feed and lie down in safety
questions.explanation: The verse states the remnant shall not do iniquity.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Zephaniah 3:14: 'Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the ______.'
questions.explanation: The verse encourages rejoicing with all the heart.

questions.question: Who is described as being in the midst of Israel in Zephaniah 3:15?
options: The LORD, the king of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD, the king of Israel
questions.explanation: The verse says the LORD, the king of Israel, is in the midst of thee.

questions.question: True or False: Zephaniah 3:16 says to Jerusalem, 'Fear thou not: and to Zion, let not thine hands be slack.'
questions.explanation: The verse encourages fearlessness and strength.

questions.question: According to Zephaniah 3:17, how will the LORD express His love for His people?
questions.explanation: The verse speaks of the LORD rejoicing over them with joy and singing.

questions.question: Who does the LORD say He will gather according to Zephaniah 3:18?
options: Those sorrowful for the solemn assembly
questions.correctAnswer: Those sorrowful for the solemn assembly
questions.explanation: The verse mentions gathering those sorrowful for the solemn assembly.

questions.question: True or False: Zephaniah 3:19 promises to save those who halt and gather those driven out.
questions.explanation: The verse promises to save and gather the afflicted and driven out.
